intro.text:
🏃‍♀️ It’s Monday morning in the urgent-care clinic. A 28-year-old marathon runner limps in, grimacing: “I feel like I’m peeing tiny daggers! 🔪💧” Vital signs are stable, no fever. Urinalysis shows 3+ leukocyte esterase and nitrites. 😂

What empiric antibiotic do you start while cultures are pending?

NitrofurantoinEmp.text:
You start Nitrofurantoin – the UTI ninja. 🥷 It hits E. coli right where it hurts and concentrates in the bladder.

Culture pending: E. coli, sensitive to everything except penicillin.

TMPSMXEmp.text:
You pick Trimethoprim-Sulfamethoxazole (TMP-SMX). 📜➕💊 Sure, it’s effective… unless local resistance is high. Fingers crossed! 🤞

Culture pending: E. coli, sensitive to everything except penicillin.

CiprofloxacinEmp.text:
You go bold with Ciprofloxacin – the fluoroquinolone flamboyance. 💃 Broad coverage, but FDA frowns at overuse. 🧐

Culture pending: E. coli, sensitive to everything except penicillin.

CephalexinEmp.text:
You grab Cephalexin – the trusty cephalosporin. 🛡️ Good against E. coli, but might not concentrate as well in urine.

Culture pending: E. coli, sensitive to everything except penicillin.

start.text:
🧫 Lab calls: “It’s uropathogenic E. coli, nitro-sensitive, TMP-SMX sensitive, cipro sensitive, cephalexin sensitive.”
“Your move, doc. What’s the best narrow-spectrum choice?”

Nitrofurantoin.text: 🎉 Perfect! Nitrofurantoin remains first-line for uncomplicated UTI. Bladder-only ninja strike. Patient pees happy by tomorrow. 🥳🚽

TMPSMX.text: 👍 TMP-SMX works, but it has more systemic effects and potential rash. Not wrong, just not the bladder-specialist. 🤷‍♀️

Ciprofloxacin.text: ❌ Too broad! Save fluoroquinolones for pyelonephritis or resistant bugs. Plus Achilles tendon risk for our marathoner. 🦶⚠️

Cephalexin.text: ❌ Cephalexin is okay, but nitrofurantoin beats it in bladder concentration. Better luck next time. 😉

Nitrofurantoin.PK: Concentrates in urine; bacteriostatic/bactericidal depending on concentration
Nitrofurantoin.Toxicities: GI upset, pulmonary fibrosis (rare), brown urine

TMPSMX.Spectrum: Gram-negative (E. coli), some Staph, PCP prophylaxis
TMPSMX.PK: Good oral bioavailability; hepatic metabolism; excreted in urine

Ciprofloxacin.Spectrum: Broad Gram-negative including Pseudomonas; some Gram-positive
Ciprofloxacin.PK: Excellent oral absorption; wide tissue distribution; renal & hepatic clearance
Ciprofloxacin.Toxicities: Tendon rupture, QT prolongation, C. difficile risk

Cephalexin.Spectrum: Gram-positive cocci & some Gram-negative (E. coli, Klebsiella)
Cephalexin.Toxicities: GI upset, rash, rare seizures in renal failure
